required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial of BAT8001 on Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics for Patients
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Dose Escalation Phase I Clinical Trial on Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of BAT8001 for Injection in Patients With HER2-Positive Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: An Open-Label, Dose Escalation Phase I Clinical Trial on Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of BAT8001 for Injection in Patients with HER2-Positive Solid Tumors (breast cancer or gastric cancer)。

detailed_description.textblock: This is an open-label, dose escalation Phase I clinical study in two stages. Stage 1 consists of the first four cycles where the tolerability, safety, pharmacokinetics and immunogenicity of BAT8001 for injections will be studied and preliminary efficacy will be evaluated. Efficacy and safety assessments continue from the fifth cycle until disease progression or intolerable toxicities.

primary_outcome.time_frame: A minimum of 21 days after first dose of BAT8001
A minimum of 21 days after first dose of BAT8001
primary_outcome.description: The highest dose level resulting in a DLT in ≤ 1 of 6 patients was declared the MTD.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve (AUC)-BAT8001(antibody-drug conjugate), total antibody and Batansine (a maytansine derivative, which is the 3AA-MDC complex)
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-infusion (Hour 0), 30 minutes after end of BAT8001 infusion on Day 1 Cycle 1, 2, 3, 4 (each cycle is 21 days) up to approximately 3 months
primary_outcome.description: AUC will be evaluated and reported for BAT8001 and its metabolites.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum serum drug concentration (Cmax)-BAT8001(antibody-drug conjugate), total antibody and Batansine (a maytansine derivative, which is the 3AA-MDC complex)
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-infusion (Hour 0), 30 minutes after end of BAT8001 infusion on Day 1 Cycle 1, 2, 3, 4 (each cycle is 21 days) up to approximately 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Maximum serum concentration (Cmax) immediately after dosing will be evaluated and reported for BAT8001 and its metabolites.

primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-infusion (Hour 0), 30 minutes after end of BAT8001 infusion on Day 1 Cycle 1, 2, 3, 4 (each cycle is 21 days) up to approximately 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Half-life (t1/2) will be evaluated and reported.

primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-infusion (Hour 0) on Day 1 of Cycle 1, 2, 3, 4 (each cycle is 21 days) up to approximately 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Plasma level of anti drug antibodies (ADA) correlated with BAT8001 plasma level

primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-infusion (Hour 0) on Day 1 of Cycle 1, 2, 3, 4 (each cycle is 21 days) up to approximately 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Neutralizing anti-drug antibodies (NADA) correlated with BAT8001

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the end of the study (up to 3 years)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from first dose date until the date of disease progression or death due to any reason, whichever occurs first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the end of the study (up to 3 years)
secondary_outcome.description: determined by the investigator according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) v1.1.

intervention.other_name: Recombinant Humanized Anti-HER2 Monoclonal Antibody-Maytansine Conjugate for Injection
